etymologies: mid 19th century: from xeno-, apparently erroneously for Greek kenos ‘vain, empty’, + timē ‘honor’ (because it was wrongly supposed to contain a new metal)

definitions: a yellowish-brown mineral which occurs in some igneous rocks and consists of a phosphate of yttrium and other rare earth elements.
shortDefinitions: yellowish-brown mineral which occurs in some igneous rocks and consists of phosphate of yttrium
